intro: Papaver suaveolens, commonly known as the sweet-scented poppy, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Europe. It produces striking, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red, often with a faintly fragrant scent. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil in full sun. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and branching. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
